resources.name: Verizon
resources.description: The Verizon Edge Discovery Service API can direct your application clients to connect to the optimal service endpoints for your Multi-access Edge Computing (MEC) applications for every session. The Edge Discovery Service takes into account the current location of a device, its IP anchor location, current network traffic and other factors to determine which 5G Edge platform a device should connect to.

resources.name: Mock Server (only available for Thingspace M2M APIs)
5G Edge Platforms
resources.description: Discover the regions in the 5G Edge service and find the optimal MEC platforms for your Edge applications.

resources.name: Service Endpoints
resources.description: Register the routable endpoints of your deployed Edge application services. After registering, use service endpoint discovery to find the optimal service endpoints for application clients to connect to for each session.

resources.name: Service Profiles
resources.description:
Create and manage profiles that describe the service characteristics of your 5G Edge applications, such as the required connection bandwidth andmaximum latency.
**Note:** For the initial release of the Edge Discovery Service API,`latency`is the only service profile property that is compared with 5G Edge platform capabilities.

resources.name: Device Management
resources.description: Manage device connectivity and get device history.

resources.name: Accounts
resources.description: Get information about an account or account leads.

resources.name: Device Groups
resources.description: Manage device groups.

resources.name: SMS
resources.description: Exchange Short Message Service (SMS) messages with devices.

resources.name: Session Management
resources.description: Start and end Connectivity Management sessions.

resources.name: Connectivity Callbacks
resources.description: Manage subscriptions to asynchronous webhook messages.

resources.name: Account Requests
resources.description: Get the status of asynchronous reqeusts.

resources.name: Service Plans
resources.description: Get a list of service plans in an account.

resources.name: Device Diagnostics
resources.description: Helps to create & manage diagnostics

resources.name: Devices Locations

resources.name: Exclusions
resources.description: Exclude devices from location services.

resources.name: Devices Location Subscriptions
resources.description: Get an account's location service subscription status and usage.

resources.name: Device Location Callbacks
resources.description: Receive notifications from the API.

resources.name: Software Management Subscriptions V1
resources.description: View Software Management Services subscription status.

resources.name: Software Management Licenses V1
resources.description: Assign Software Management Services license to devices **Note:**These endpoints have been deprecated. Please use the **v3** endpoints.

resources.name: Firmware V1
resources.description: Schedule and monitor firmware upgrades.

resources.name: Software Management Callbacks V1
resources.description: Register and deregister callback endpoints.

resources.name: Software Management Reports V1
resources.description: Status and history information.

resources.name: Software Management Subscriptions V2
resources.description: Information about current FOTA subscriptions.

resources.name: Software Management Licenses V2
resources.description: License status and assignment.

resources.name: Campaigns V2
resources.description: Schedule, retreive or cancel scheduled FOTA campaigns.

resources.name: Software Management Callbacks V2
resources.description: Find registered callbacks or create, update and delete a registered callback.

resources.name: Software Management Reports V2
resources.description: Status of a campaign per device.

resources.name: Client Logging
resources.description: Device logs stored on the device itself.

resources.name: Server Logging
resources.description: Device logs on the server.

resources.name: Software Management Subscriptions V3
resources.description: Information about current FOTA subscriptions.

resources.name: Software Management Licenses V3
resources.description: License status and assignment.

resources.name: Campaigns V3
resources.description: Schedule, retreive or cancel scheduled FOTA campaigns.

resources.name: Software Management Reports V3
resources.description: Status of a campaign per device.

resources.name: Firmware V3
resources.description: State of Firmware across devices in the account.

resources.name: Account Devices
resources.description: Device information for an account.

resources.name: Software Management Callbacks V3
resources.description: Find registered callbacks or create, update and delete a registered callback.

resources.name: Performance Metrics
resources.description: This API is for use by clients and OEMs to measure the performance of Verizon's Mobile Edge Compute (MEC) solution.

resources.name: Anomaly Settings
resources.description: Choose what level and interval of alerting for anomalies detected.

resources.name: Anomaly Triggers
resources.description: Set the threshold of notification for anomalies detected.

resources.name: Managing eSIM Profiles
resources.description: Manage Global IoT Orchestration device profiles for either Verizon (lead) or Global (local).

resources.name: Device SMS Messaging
resources.description: Send Short Message Service (SMS) messages to devices

resources.name: Device Actions
resources.description: Device management for either Verizon (lead) or Global (local) profiles.

resources.name: ThingSpace Quality of Service API Actions
resources.description: Subscribe or Unsubscribe to the ThingSpace Quality of Service API.

resources.name: Promotion Period Information
resources.description: Retrieve status and information about the promotion period for using a pseudo-MDN (Mobile Device Number))

resources.name: Retrieve the Triggers
resources.description: Retrieve the triggers associated with the feature and the account.

resources.name: Update Triggers
resources.description: Updates the trigger threshold values for alerts.

resources.name: SIM Actions
resources.description: Activate and Deactivate the SIM.

resources.name: Global Reporting
resources.description: Use these endpoints to determine the status of requests or the history of device provisioning.

resources.name: ListMECPlatforms
resources.description: Returns a list of optimal MEC Platforms where you can register your deployed application. **Note:** If a query is sent with all of the parameters, it will fail with a "400" error. You can search based on the following parameter combinations - region plus Service Profile ID and subscriber density (density is optional but recommended), region plus UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type) or Service Profile ID plus UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type).

resources.name: ListRegions
resources.description: List the geographical regions available, based on the user's bearer token. **Note:** Country code, Metropolitan area, Area and Zone are future functionality and will currently return a "null" value.

resources.name: ListOptimalServiceEndpoints
resources.description: Returns a list of optimal Service Endpoints that client devices can connect to. **Note:** If a query is sent with all of the parameters, it will fail with a "400" error. You can search based on the following parameter combinations - Region plus Service Endpoints IDs and Subscriber density (density is optional but recommended), Region plus Service Endpoints IDs and UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type) and Service Endpoints IDs plus UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type).

resources.name: RegisterServiceEndpoints
resources.description: Register Service Endpoints of a deployed application to specified MEC Platforms.

resources.name: ListAllServiceEndpoints
resources.description: Returns a list of all registered service endpoints.

resources.name: GetServiceEndpoint
resources.description: Returns endpoint information for all Service Endpoints registered to a specified serviceEndpointId.

resources.name: UpdateServiceEndpoint
resources.description: Update registered Service Endpoint information.

resources.name: DeregisterServiceEndpoint
resources.description: Deregister an application's Service Endpoint from the MEC Platform(s).

resources.name: CreateServiceProfile
resources.description: Creates a service profile that describes the resource requirements of a service.

resources.name: ListServiceProfiles
resources.description: List all service profiles registered under your API key.

resources.name: GetServiceProfile
resources.description: Returns a specified service profile.

resources.name: UpdateServiceProfile
resources.description: Update the definition of a Service Profile.

resources.name: DeleteServiceProfile
resources.description: Delete Service Profile based on unique service profile ID.

resources.name: ActivateServiceForDevices
resources.description: If the devices do not already exist in the account, this API resource adds them before activation.

resources.name: AddDevices
resources.description: Use this API if you want to manage some device settings before you are ready to activate service for the devices.

resources.name: UpdateDevicesContactInformation
resources.description: Sends a CarrierService callback message for each device in the request when the contact information has been changed, or if there was a problem and the change could not be completed.

resources.name: UpdateDevicesCustomFields
resources.description: Sends a CarrierService callback message for each device in the request when the custom fields have been changed, or if there was a problem and the change could not be completed.

resources.name: DeactivateServiceForDevices
resources.description: Deactivating service for a device may result in an early termination fee (ETF) being charged to the account, depending on the terms of the contract with Verizon. If your contract allows ETF waivers and if you want to use one for a particular deactivation, set the etfWaiver value to True.

resources.name: DeleteDeactivatedDevices
resources.description: Use this API to remove unneeded devices from an account.

resources.name: ListDevicesInformation
resources.description: Returns information about a single device or information about all devices that match the given parameters. Returned information includes device provisioning state, service plan, MDN, MIN, and IP address.

resources.name: ListDevicesWithImeiIccidMismatch
resources.description: Returns a list of all 4G devices with an ICCID (SIM) that was not activated with the expected IMEI (hardware) during a specified time frame.

resources.name: MoveDevicesWithinAccountsOfProfile
resources.description: Move active devices from one billing account to another within a customer profile.

resources.name: UpdateDevicesState
resources.description: Changes the provisioning state of one or more devices to a specified customer-defined service and state.

resources.name: ChangeDevicesServicePlan
resources.description: Changes the service plan for one or more devices.

resources.name: SuspendServiceForDevices
resources.description: Suspends service for one or more devices.

resources.name: RestoreServiceForSuspendedDevices
resources.description: Restores service to one or more suspended devices.

resources.name: CheckDevicesAvailabilityForActivation
resources.description: Checks whether specified devices are registered by the manufacturer with the Verizon network and are available to be activated.

resources.name: RetrieveDeviceConnectionHistory
resources.description: Each response includes a maximum of 500 records. To obtain more records, you can call the API multiple times, adjusting the earliest value each time to start where the previous request finished.

resources.name: UpdateDevicesCostCenterCode
resources.description: Changes or removes the CostCenterCode value or customer name and address (Primary Place of Use) for one or more devices.

resources.name: GetDeviceExtendedDiagnosticInformation
resources.description: Returns extended diagnostic information about a specified device, including connectivity, provisioning, billing and location status.

resources.name: ListDevicesProvisioningHistory
resources.description: Returns the provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.

resources.name: ListCurrentDevicesPRLVersion
resources.description: 4G and GSM devices do not have a PRL.

resources.name: GetDeviceServiceSuspensionStatus
resources.description: Returns DeviceSuspensionStatus callback messages containing the current device state and information on how many days a device has been suspended and can continue to be suspended.

resources.name: ListDevicesUsageHistory
resources.description: Returns the network data usage history of a device during a specified time period.

resources.name: RetrieveAggregateDeviceUsageHistory
resources.description: The information is returned in a callback response, so you must register a URL for DeviceUsage callback messages using the POST /callbacks API.

resources.name: UpdateDeviceId
resources.description: Changes the identifier of a 3G or 4G device to match hardware changes made for a line of service. Use this request to transfer the line of service and the MDN to new hardware, or to change the MDN.

resources.name: DeviceUpload
resources.description: This corresponds to the M2M-MC SOAP interface, ```DeviceUploadService```.

resources.name: BilledUsageInfo
resources.description: Gets billed usage for for either multiple devices or an entire billing account.

resources.name: UsageSegmentationLabelAssociation
resources.description: Allows you to associate your own usage segmentation label with a device.

resources.name: UsageSegmentationLabelDeletion
resources.description: Allow customers to remove the associated label from a device.

resources.name: ActivationOrderStatus
resources.description: Uploads and activates device identifiers and SKUs for new devices from OEMs to Verizon.

resources.name: UploadDeviceIdentifier
resources.description: Checks the status of an activation order and lists where the order is in the provisioning process.

resources.name: GetAccountInformation
resources.description: Returns information about a specified account.

resources.name: ListAccountStatesAndServices
resources.description: Returns a list and details of all custom services and states defined for a specified account.

resources.name: ListAccountLeads
resources.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /leads/{aname}?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of leads.

resources.name: CreateDeviceGroup
resources.description: Create a new device group and optionally add devices to the group. Device groups can make it easier to manage similar devices and to get reports on their usage.

resources.name: ListDeviceGroups
resources.description: Returns a list of all device groups in a specified account.

resources.name: GetDeviceGroupInformation
resources.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /groups/{aname}/name/{gname}/?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of groups.

resources.name: UpdateDeviceGroup

body.text: {"newGroupName":"Western region tanks","newGroupDescription":"All western region tank level monitors.","devicesToAdd":[{"kind":"imei","id":"990003420535537"}]}

resources.description: Make changes to a device group, including changing the name and description, and adding or removing devices.

resources.name: DeleteDeviceGroup
resources.description: Deletes a device group from the account. Devices in the group are moved to the default device group and are not deleted from the account.

resources.name: SendSMSToDevice

body.text: {"servicePlan":"T Plan 2","smsMessage":"The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain."}

resources.description: The messages are queued on the ThingSpace Platform and sent as soon as possible, but they may be delayed due to traffic and routing considerations.

resources.name: ListDevicesSMSMessages
resources.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /sms/{aname}/history?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of messages.

resources.name: StartQueuedSMSDelivery
resources.description: Tells the ThingSpace Platform to start sending mobile-originated SMS messages through the EnhancedConnectivityService callback service. SMS messages from devices are queued until they are retrieved by your application, either by callback or synchronously with GET /sms/{accountName}/history.

resources.name: StartConnectivityManagementSession
resources.description: Initiates a Connectivity Management session and returns a VZ-M2M session token that is required in subsequent API requests.

resources.name: EndConnectivityManagementSession
resources.description: Ends a Connectivity Management session.

resources.name: ResetConnectivityManagementPassword
resources.description: The new password is effective immediately. Passwords do not expire, but Verizon recommends changing your password every 90 days.

resources.name: ListRegisteredCallbacks
resources.description: Returns the name and endpoint URL of the callback listening services registered for a given account.

resources.name: RegisterCallback
resources.description: You are responsible for creating and running a listening process on your server at that URL.

resources.name: DeregisterCallback
resources.description: Stops ThingSpace from sending callback messages for the specified account and service.

resources.name: GetCurrentAsynchronousRequestStatus
resources.description: Returns the current status of an asynchronous request that was made for a single device.

resources.name: ListAccountServicePlans
resources.description: Returns a list of all data service plans that are associated with a specified billing account. When you send a request to /devices/actions/activate to activate a line of service you must specify the code for one of the service plans associated with your account.

resources.name: DeviceReachabilityStatusUsingPOST
resources.description: If the devices do not already exist in the account, this API resource adds them before activation.

resources.name: RetrieveActiveMonitorsUsingPOST
resources.description: Retrieve all the active monitors.

resources.name: ActivateDeviceThroughProfile

body.text: {"devices":[{"deviceIds":[{"id":"32-digit EID","kind":"eid"},{"id":"15-digit IMEI","kind":"imei"}]}],"accountName":"0000123456-00001","servicePlan":"The service plan name","mdnZipCode":"five digit zip code"}

resources.description: Uses the profile to bring the device under management.

resources.name: ProfileToActivateDevice
resources.description: Uses the profile to activate the device.

resources.name: ProfileToDeactivateDevice
resources.description: Uses the profile to deactivate the device.

resources.name: ProfileToSetFallbackAttribute
resources.description: Allows the profile to set the fallback attribute to the device.

resources.name: DownloadLocalProfileToEnable
resources.description: Downloads an eUICC local profile to devices and enables the profile.

resources.name: DownloadLocalProfileToDisable
resources.description: Downloads an eUICC local profile to devices and leaves the profile disabled.

resources.name: EnableLocalProfile
resources.description: Enable a local profile that has been downloaded to eUICC devices.

resources.name: DisableLocalProfile
resources.description: Disable a local profile on eUICC devices. The default or boot profile will become the enabled profile.

resources.name: DeleteLocalProfile
resources.description: Delete a local profile from eUICC devices. If the local profile is enabled, it will first be disabled and the boot or default profile will be enabled.

resources.name: ListDevicesLocationsSynchronous
resources.description: This locations endpoint retrieves the locations for a list of devices.

resources.name: ListDevicesLocationsAsynchronous
resources.description: Requests the current or cached location of up to 10,000 IoT or consumer devices (phones, tablets. etc.). This request returns a synchronous transaction ID, and the location information for each device is returned asynchronously as a DeviceLocation callback message.

resources.name: CancelDeviceLocationRequest
resources.description: Cancel a queued or unfinished device location request.

resources.name: CreateLocationReport
resources.description: Request an asynchronous device location report.

resources.name: RetrieveLocationReport
resources.description: Download a completed asynchronous device location report.

resources.name: GetLocationReportStatus
resources.description: Returns the current status of a requested device location report.

resources.name: CancelQueuedLocationReportGeneration
resources.description: Cancel a queued device location report.

resources.name: ExcludeDevices
resources.description: This consents endpoint sets a new exclusion list.

resources.name: RemoveDevicesFromExclusionList
resources.description: Removes devices from the exclusion list so that they can be located with Device Location Services requests.

resources.name: ListExcludedDevices
resources.description: This consents endpoint retrieves a list of excluded devices in an account.

resources.name: GetLocationServiceSubscriptionStatus
resources.description: This subscriptions endpoint retrieves an account's current location subscription status.

resources.name: GetLocationServiceUsage
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to search for billable usage for accounts based on the provided date range.

resources.name: ListRegisteredCallbacks
resources.description: Returns a list of all registered callback URLs for the account.

resources.name: RegisterCallback
resources.description: Provide a URL to receive messages from a ThingSpace callback service.

resources.name: DeregisterCallback
resources.description: Deregister a URL to stop receiving callback messages.

resources.name: CreateNewTrigger
resources.description: Create a new usage trigger, which will send an alert when the number of device location service transactions reaches a specified percentage of the monthly subscription amount.

resources.name: UpdateTrigger
resources.description: Update an existing usage trigger

resources.name: DeleteTrigger
resources.description: eletes the specified usage trigger from the given account

resources.name: AddAccount
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to add managed accounts to a primary account.

resources.name: ManagedAccountAction
resources.description: Activates a managed billing service relationship between a managed account and the primary account.

resources.name: CancelManagedAccountAction
resources.description: Deactivates a managed billing service relationship between a managed account and the primary account.

resources.name: ListManagedAccount
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to retrieve the list of all accounts managed by a primary account.

resources.name: GetAccountSubscriptionStatus
resources.description: This subscriptions endpoint retrieves an account's current Software Management Service subscription status.

resources.name: GetAccountLicenseStatus
resources.description: Returns information about an account's Software Management Services licenses and a list of licensed devices.

resources.name: AssignLicensesToDevices
resources.description: Assigns licenses to a specified list of devices so that firmware upgrades can be scheduled for those devices.

resources.name: RemoveLicensesFromDevices
resources.description: Remove unused licenses from device.

resources.name: CreateListOfLicensesToRemove
resources.description: Creates a list of devices from which licenses will be removed if the number of MRC licenses becomes less than the number of assigned licenses.

resources.name: DeleteListOfLicensesToRemove
resources.description: Deletes the entire list of cancellation candidate devices.

resources.name: ListLicensesToRemove
resources.description: Returns a list of devices from which licenses will be removed if the number of MRC licenses becomes less than the number of assigned licenses.

resources.name: ListAvailableFirmware
resources.description: Lists all device firmware images available for an account, based on the devices registered to that account.

resources.name: ScheduleFirmwareUpgrade
resources.description: Schedules a firmware upgrade for devices.

resources.name: ListFirmwareUpgradeDetails
resources.description: Returns information about a specified upgrade, include the target date of the upgrade, the list of devices in the upgrade, and the status of the upgrade for each device.

resources.name: UpdateFirmwareUpgradeDevices
resources.description: Add or remove devices from a scheduled upgrade.

resources.name: CancelScheduledFirmwareUpgrade
resources.description: Cancel a scheduled firmware upgrade.

resources.name: ListRegisteredCallbacks
resources.description: Returns the name and endpoint URL of the callback listening services registered for a given account.

resources.name: RegisterCallback
resources.description: Registers a URL to receive RESTful messages from a callback service when new firmware versions are available and when upgrades start and finish.

resources.name: DeregisterCallback
resources.description: Deregisters the callback endpoint and stops ThingSpace from sending FOTA callback messages for the specified account.

resources.name: ListAccountDevices
resources.description: Returns an array of all devices in the specified account. Each device object includes information needed for managing firmware, including the device make and model, MDN and IMEI, and current firmware version.

resources.name: ListUpgradesForSpecifiedStatus
resources.description: Returns a list of all upgrades with a specified status.

resources.name: GetDeviceFirmwareUpgradeHistory
resources.description: Returns the upgrade history of the specified device from the previous six months.

resources.name: GetAccountSubscriptionStatus
resources.description: This endpoint retrieves a FOTA subscription by account.

resources.name: GetAccountLicenseStatus
resources.description: The endpoint allows user to list license usage.

resources.name: AssignLicensesToDevices
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to assign licenses to a list of devices.

resources.name: RemoveLicensesFromDevices
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to remove licenses from a list of devices.

resources.name: ListLicensesToRemove
resources.description: The license cancel endpoint allows user to list registered license cancellation candidate devices.

resources.name: CreateListOfLicensesToRemove
resources.description: The license cancel endpoint allows user to create a list of license cancellation candidate devices.

resources.name: DeleteListOfLicensesToRemove
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to delete a created cancel candidate device list.

resources.name: ScheduleCampaignFirmwareUpgrade
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to schedule a software upgrade.

resources.name: GetCampaignInformation
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to get information of a software upgrade.

resources.name: UpdateCampaignFirmwareDevices
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to Add or Remove devices to an existing software upgrade.

resources.name: CancelCampaign
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to cancel software upgrade. A software upgrade already started can not be cancelled.

resources.name: UpdateCampaignDates
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to change campaign dates and time windows. Fields which need to remain unchanged should be also provided.

resources.name: ScheduleFileUpgrade
resources.description: You can upload configuration files and schedule them in a campaign to devices.

resources.name: ScheduleSWUpgradeHttpDevices
resources.description: Campaign time windows for downloading and installing software are available as long as the device OEM supports this.

resources.name: ListRegisteredCallbacks
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to get the registered callback information.

resources.name: UpdateCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to update the HTTPS callback address.

resources.name: RegisterCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to create the HTTPS callback address.

resources.name: DeregisterCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to delete a previously registered callback URL.

resources.name: ListAvailableSoftware
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to list a certain type of software of an account.

resources.name: ListAccountDevices
resources.description: The device endpoint gets devices information of an account.

resources.name: GetDeviceFirmwareUpgradeHistory
resources.description: The endpoint allows user to get software upgrade history of a device based on device IMEI.

resources.name: GetCampaignHistoryByStatus
resources.description: The report endpoint allows user to get campaign history of an account for specified status.

resources.name: GetCampaignDeviceStatus
resources.description: The report endpoint allows user to get the full list of device of a campaign.

resources.name: ListDevicesWithLoggingEnabled
resources.description: Returns an array of all devices in the specified account for which logging is enabled.

resources.name: EnableLoggingForDevices
resources.description: Each customer may have a maximum of 20 devices enabled for logging.

resources.name: DisableLoggingForDevices
resources.description: Turn logging off for a list of devices.

resources.name: EnableDeviceLogging
resources.description: Enables logging for a specific device.

resources.name: DisableDeviceLogging
resources.description: Disables logging for a specific device.

resources.name: ListDeviceLogs
resources.description: Gets logs for a specific device.

resources.name: GetDeviceCheckInHistory
resources.description: Check-in history can be retrieved for any device belonging to the account, not necessarily with logging enabled.

resources.name: GetListOfFiles
resources.description: You can retrieve a list of configuration or supplementary of files for an account.

resources.name: UploadConfigFile
resources.description: Uploads a configuration/supplementary file for an account. ThingSpace generates a fileName after the upload and is returned in the response.

resources.name: GetAccountSubscriptionStatus
resources.description: This endpoint retrieves a FOTA subscription by account.

resources.name: GetAccountLicensesStatus
resources.description: The endpoint allows user to list license usage.

resources.name: AssignLicensesToDevices
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to assign licenses to a list of devices.

resources.name: RemoveLicensesFromDevices
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to remove licenses from a list of devices.

resources.name: ScheduleCampaignFirmwareUpgrade
resources.description: This endpoint allows a user to schedule a firmware upgrade for a list of devices.

resources.name: UpdateCampaignFirmwareDevices
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to Add or Remove devices to an existing campaign.

resources.name: UpdateCampaignDates
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to change campaign dates and time windows. Fields which need to remain unchanged should be also provided.

resources.name: GetCampaignInformation
resources.description: This endpoint allows the user to retrieve campaign level information for a specified campaign.

resources.name: CancelCampaign
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to cancel a firmware campaign. A firmware campaign already started can not be cancelled.

resources.name: GetCampaignHistoryByStatus
resources.description: Retrieve a list of campaigns for an account that have a specified campaign status.

resources.name: GetDeviceFirmwareUpgradeHistory
resources.description: Retrieve campaign history for a specific device.

resources.name: GetCampaignDeviceStatus
resources.description: Retrieve a list of all devices in a campaign and the status of each device.

resources.name: ListAvailableFirmware
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to list the firmware of an account.

resources.name: SynchronizeDeviceFirmware
resources.description: Synchronize ThingSpace with the FOTA server for up to 100 devices.

resources.name: ReportDeviceFirmware
resources.description: Ask a device to report its firmware version asynchronously.

resources.name: GetAccountDeviceInformation
resources.description: Retrieve account device information such as reported firmware on the devices.

resources.name: ListAccountDevicesInformation
resources.description: Retrieve device information for a list of devices on an account.

resources.name: ListRegisteredCallbacks
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to get the registered callback information.

resources.name: UpdateCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows the user to update the HTTPS callback address.

resources.name: RegisterCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows the user to create the HTTPS callback address.

resources.name: DeregisterCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to delete a previously registered callback URL.

resources.name: AssignLicenseToDevices
resources.description: Assigns SIM-Secure for IoT licenses to SIMs.

resources.name: UnassignLicenseToDevices
resources.description: Unassigns SIM-Secure for IoT Flexible and Flexible Bundle license from SIMs.

resources.name: ListAccountSubscriptions
resources.description: Retrieves the total number of SIM-Secure for IoT subscription licenses purchased for your account by license type, and lists the number of licenses assigned and available for each license type.

resources.name: QueryMECPerformanceMetrics
resources.description: Query the most recent data for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) like network availability, MEC hostnames and more.

resources.name: GetDiagnosticsSubscription
resources.description: This endpoint retrieves a diagnostics subscription by account.

resources.name: StartDiagnosticsObservation
resources.description: This endpoint allows the user to start or change observe diagnostics.

resources.name: StopDiagnosticsObservation
resources.description: This endpoint allows the user to stop or reset observe diagnostics.

resources.name: GetDiagnosticsHistory
resources.description: This endpoint allows the user to get the history data.

resources.name: ListDiagnosticsSettings
resources.description: This endpoint retrieves diagnostics settings synchronously.

resources.name: GetDiagnosticsSubscriptionCallbackInfo
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to get the registered callback information of an existing diagnostics subscription.

resources.name: RegisterDiagnosticsCallbackURL
resources.description: This endpoint allows user update the callback HTTPS address of an existing diagnostics subscription.

resources.name: UnregisterDiagnosticsCallback
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to delete a registered callback URL and credential.

resources.name: DecivesRestart
resources.description: Performs a device reboot or a factory reset on the modem portion of the device.

resources.name: QueryTarget
resources.description: Search for targets by property values. Returns an array of all matching target resources.

resources.name: DeleteTarget
resources.description: Remove a target from a ThingSpace account.

resources.name: CreateTarget
resources.description: Define a target to receive data streams, alerts, or callbacks. After creating the target resource, use its ID in a subscription to set up a data stream.

resources.name: GenerateTargetExternalID
resources.description: Create a unique string that ThingSpace will pass to AWS for increased security.

resources.name: CreateAzureCentralIoTApplication
resources.description: Deploy a new Azure IoT Central application based on the Verizon ARM template within the specified Azure Active Directory account.

resources.name: CreateSubscription
resources.description: Create a subscription to define a streaming channel that sends data from devices in the account to an endpoint defined in a target resource.

resources.name: QuerySubscription
resources.description: Search for subscriptions by property values. Returns an array of all matching subscription resources.

resources.name: DeleteSubscription
resources.description: Remove a subscription from a ThingSpace account.

resources.name: UpdateDevicesConfigurationValue
resources.description: Change configuration values on a device, such as setting how often a device records and reports sensor readings.

resources.name: FindDeviceByPropertyValues
resources.description: Find devices by property values. Returns an array of all matching device resources.

resources.name: SearchDevicesResourcesByPropertyValues
resources.description: Search for devices by property values. Returns an array of all matching device resources.

resources.name: SearchDeviceEventHistory
resources.description: Search device event history to find events that match criteria.Sensor readings, configuration changes, and other device data are all stored as events.

resources.name: SearchSensorReadings
resources.description: Returns the readings of a specified sensor, with the most recent reading first. Sensor readings are stored as events; this request an array of events.

resources.name: DeleteDeviceFromAccount
resources.description: Remove a device from a ThingSpace account.

resources.name: GetDeviceHyperPreciseStatus
resources.description: Gets the list of a status for hyper-precise location devices.

resources.name: UpdateDeviceHyperPreciseStatus
resources.description: Enable/disable hyper-precise service for a device.

resources.name: CalculateAggregatedReportSynchronous
resources.description: Calculate aggregated report per day with number of sessions and usage information. User will receive synchronous response for specified list of devices (Max 10) and date range (Max 180 days).

resources.name: CalculateAggregatedReportAsynchronous
resources.description: Calculate aggregated report per day with number of sessions and usage information. User will receive an asynchronous callback for the specified list of devices (Max 10000) and date range (Max 180 days).

resources.name: GetSessionsReport
resources.description: Detailed report of session duration and number of bytes transferred per day.

resources.name: ListRegisteredCallbacks
resources.description: Find registered callback listener for account by account number.

resources.name: RegisterCallback
resources.description: Registers a URL at which an account receives asynchronous responses and other messages from a ThingSpace Platform callback service. The messages are REST messages. You are responsible for creating and running a listening process on your server at that URL to receive and parse the messages.

resources.name: DeregisterCallback
resources.description: Stops ThingSpace from sending callback messages for the specified account and listener name.

resources.name: ActivateAnomalyDetection
resources.description: Uses the subscribed account ID to activate anomaly detection and set threshold values.

resources.name: ListAnomalyDetectionSettings
resources.description: Retrieves the current anomaly detection settings for an account.

resources.name: ResetAnomalyDetectionParameters
resources.description: Resets the thresholds to zero.

resources.name: ListAnomalyDetectionTriggers
resources.description: This corresponds to the M2M-MC SOAP interface, ```GetTriggers```.

resources.name: UpdateAnomalyDetectionTrigger
resources.description: This corresponds to the M2M-MC SOAP interface, ```UpdateTriggerRequest```.

resources.name: CreateAnomalyDetectionTrigger
resources.description: This corresponds to the M2M-MC SOAP interface, ```CreateTrigger```.

resources.name: ListAnomalyDetectionTriggerSettings
resources.description: This corresponds to the M2M-MC SOAP interface, ```GetTriggers```.

resources.name: DeleteAnomalyDetectionTrigger
resources.description: Deletes a specific trigger ID

resources.name: CreateAnomalyDetectionTriggerV2
resources.description: Creates the trigger to identify an anomaly.

resources.name: UpdateAnomalyDetectionTriggerV2

body.text: [{"triggerId":"595f5c44-c31c-4552-8670-020a1545a84d","triggerName":"Anomaly Daily Usage REST Test-Patch Update 4","accountName":"0000123456-00001","triggerCategory":"UsageAnomaly","anomalyTriggerRequest":{"accountNames":"0000123456-00001","includeAbnormal":true,"includeVeryAbnormal":true,"includeUnderExpectedUsage":false,"includeOverExpectedUsage":true},"notification":{"notificationType":"DailySummary","callback":true,"emailNotification":false,"notificationGroupName":"Anomaly Test API","notificationFrequencyFactor":3,"notificationFrequencyInterval":"Hourly","externalEmailRecipients":"placeholder@verizon.com","smsNotification":true,"smsNumbers":[{"carrier":"US Cellular","number":"9299280711"}],"reminder":true,"severity":"Critical"}}]

resources.description: Updates an existing trigger using the account name.

resources.name: ListAnomalyDetectionTriggerSettingsV2
resources.description: Retrieves the values for a specific trigger ID.

resources.name: NearRealTimeNetworkConditions
resources.description: WNP Query for current network condition.

resources.name: Domestic4GAnd5GNationwideNetworkCoverage
resources.description: Run a report to determine network types available and available coverage. Network types covered include: CAT-M, NB-IOT, LTE, LTE-AWS and 5GNW.

resources.name: SiteProximity
resources.description: Identify the direction and general distance of nearby cell sites and the technology supported by the equipment.

resources.name: DeviceExperience30daysHistory
resources.description: A report of a specific device's service scores over a 30 day period.

resources.name: DeviceExperienceBulkLatest
resources.description: Run a report to view the latest device experience score for specific devices.

resources.name: Domestic4GAnd5GFixedWirelessQualification
resources.description: Use this query for Fixed Wireless Qualification of an address. Network types include: LTE, C-BAND and MMWAVE.

resources.name: ActivateADeviceProfile
resources.description: Activate a device with either a lead or local profile.

resources.name: EnableADeviceProfile
resources.description: Enable a device lead or local profile.

resources.name: DeactivateADeviceProfile
resources.description: Deactivate the lead or local profile. **Note:** to reactivate the profile, use the **Activate** endpoint above.

resources.name: EnableADeviceProfileForDownload
resources.description: Enable the Global IoT Orchestration device profile for download.

resources.name: DownloadADeviceProfile
resources.description: Download a Global IoT Orchestration device profile.

resources.name: DeleteADeviceProfile
resources.description: Delete a device profile for Global IoT Orchestration. **Note:** the profile must be deactivated first!

resources.name: SendAnSmsMessage
resources.description: Sends an SMS message to one device. Messages are queued on the M2M MC Platform and sent as soon as possible, but they may be delayed due to traffic and routing considerations.

resources.name: GetSmsMessages
resources.description: Retrieves queued SMS messages sent by all M2M MC devices associated with an account.

resources.name: StartSmsMessageDelivery
resources.description: Starts delivery of SMS messages for the specified account.

resources.name: ListSmsMessageHistory
resources.description: Returns a list of sms history for a given device during a specified time frame.

resources.name: RetrieveTheGlobalDeviceList
resources.description: Allows the profile to fetch the complete device list. This works with Verizon US and Global profiles.

resources.name: RetrieveDeviceProvisioningHistory
resources.description: Retreive the provisioning history of a specific device or devices.

resources.name: GetAsynchronousRequestStatus
resources.description: Get the status of an asynchronous request made with the Device Actions.

resources.name: CreateAThingSpaceQualityOfServiceAPISubscription
resources.description: Creates a QoS elevation subscription ID and activates the subscription.

resources.name: StopAThingSpaceQualityOfServiceAPISubscription
resources.description: Stops an active ThingSpace Quality of Service API subscription using the account name and the subscription ID.

resources.name: getPromoDeviceUsageHistory
resources.description: Retrieves the usage history of a device during the promotion period.

resources.name: GetPromoDeviceAggregateUsageHistory
resources.description: Retrieves the aggregate usage for an account using pseudo-MDN during the promotional period using a callback.

resources.name: GetAllAvailableTriggers
resources.description: Retrieves all of the available triggers for pseudo-MDN.

resources.name: GetAllTriggersByAccountName
resources.description: Retrieve the triggers associated with an account name.

resources.name: GetAllTriggersByTriggerCategory
resources.description: Retrieves all of the triggers for the specified account associated with the PromoAlert category

resources.name: GetTriggersById
resources.description: Retrives a specific trigger by its ID.

resources.name: UpdateAllAvailableTriggers
resources.description: Updates the promotional triggers for pseudo-MDN.

resources.name: setactivateUsingPOST
resources.description: Uses the profile to activate the SIM.

resources.name: setdeactivateUsingPOST
resources.description: Uses the profile to deactivate the SIM.

resources.name: deviceprovhistoryUsingPOST
resources.description: Retreive the provisioning history of a specific device or devices.

resources.name: requeststatususingGET
resources.description: Get the status of a request made with the Device Actions.

resources.name: RegisterIMPVendor
resources.description: With this API call the users (clients) register themselves as Vendors to the IMP system. Therefore, when a registration is initiated from a device or software service to the IMP system with the registered VendorID, then the client registration will be authorized.

resources.name: UnregisterIMPVendor
resources.description: With this API call the users (clients) can unregister themselves from the IMP system. The devices and services for this Vendor will no longer be able to use the IMP Message Exchange.

resources.name: RegisterIMPDevice
resources.description:
With this API call the user (client) registers its device or software service to the IMP system. Therefore, when a connection is initiated from the device or software service to the IMP system along with the credential provided by this registration call, then the connection will be authorized.
Note 1: One user can register multiple devices or software services, which can all be used at the same time.

Note 2: The user needs to authenticate with their ThingSpace credentials and request a bearer token in order to call this API.

resources.name: UnregisterIMPDevice
resources.description: With this API call the user (client) can unregister its devices and software services from the IMP system. The unregistered devices and services will no longer be able to use the IMP Message Exchange.

resources.name: RetrieveMQTTurl
resources.description:
With this API call the  or software service requests the MQTT URL for the location that it needs to connect. To determine the proper URL the device or software service needs to provide its ID (the one that was provided in the registration request), location (GPS coordinates), and whether it is on the Verizon cellular network or not.

Note: The user needs to authenticate with their ThingSpace credentials and request a bearer token in order to call this API.

resources.name: UploadMapDataMessage
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to upload map messages in asn.1 J2735 encoded format. The MapData can have one or more intersections.

resources.name: DownloadMapDataMessage
resources.description: This endpoint allows user to download SAE J2735 MAP messages in ASN.1 UPER format. The area for the MAP messages is needed to be defined in the query.
